title: BREAKFAST FOR DINNER
subtitle: Breakfast is always a bright idea—especially when you have it for dinner. These dishes feed hungry folks fast, any time of day.

components.text: 5-INGREDIENT RECIPES
Breakfast for Dinner
Breakfast is always a bright idea—especially when you have it for dinner. These dishes feed hungry folks fast, any time of day.
Black Bean Breakfast Bowls

HANDS-ON 10 min.br>TOTAL 15 min.br>SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY MATT D
81 REVIEWS

components.html:
1Tbsp. olive oil
8eggs, lightly beaten
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
1(15-oz.) can black beans, rinsed and drained
2Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
2avocados, peeled and sliced
½cup chilled fresh salsa or pico de gallo

components.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add eggs, salt, and pepper; cook, stirring, until eggs are set, 3 to 5 minutes. Put beans in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave, covered, until warm, about 1 minute. Stir in cilantro. Divide warmed beans among 4 serving bowls. Top each with eggs, avocado slices, and salsa.
armagazine.com/black-bean-breakfast-bowls
HEALTHY | VEGETARIAN
PER BOWL: 370 CAL; 23G FAT (5G SAT); 18G PRO; 22G CARB (8G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 650MG SODIUM

“My mom had the great idea to dress this up with some fresh fruit (plums and bananas) alongside fried red potatoes with onions and bell peppers.”
– BRAD FOSTER
No Black Beans?
No worries. Any plain canned beans will work in this recipe. Pinto beans or chickpeas are especially delicious.
Avocado Toast With Pancetta

HANDS-ON 15 min.br>TOTAL 25 min.br>SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY DORINDA MEDLEY
10 REVIEWS

components.html:
4slices pancetta or bacon, chopped
4eggs
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
4(¾-inch) slices rye bread, toasted
2avocados, peeled and mashed
Hot sauce, to taste

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook pancetta in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until browned and crisp. Transfer to paper towels, reserving drippings in skillet.
<lede>2.</lede> Crack eggs into skillet, leaving space between them. Cook over medium-low heat until desired doneness, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer eggs to a plate; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
<lede>3.</lede> Spread toast with avocado then top with pancetta, hot sauce, and eggs.
armagazine.com/avocado-toast-with-pancetta
HIDDEN GEM | HEALTHY | QUICK
PER TOAST: 357 CAL; 24G FAT (6G SAT); 15G PRO; 22G CARB; 6G FIBER; 584MG SODIUM; 2G SUGARS

“I cooked the white parts of chopped green onions with the pancetta and used the greens as a garnish. It was so good, I made it three times in one week!”
– HEIMLILY
Chaffles

HANDS-ON 10 min.br>TOTAL 15 min.br>MAKES 2 (4-INCH) WAFFLES
SUBMITTED BY LUTZFLCAT
16 REVIEWS

<italic>Chaffles—cheese waffles made with eggs—are a fun packaging of eggs and cheese. For savory chaffles, serve with a fried egg and spinach sautéed in butter. To make it more breakfasty, use melted butter and syrup, or add chocolate curls, sliced strawberries, and a dollop whipped cream.</italic>

components.html:
1egg
1Tbsp. blanched almond flour
¼tsp. baking powder
½cup shredded mozzarella cheese

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Whisk together egg, almond flour, and baking powder in a small bowl. Stir in mozzarella.

<lede>2.</lede> Preheat a round or square waffle maker according to manufacturer’s instructions and coat with cooking spray. Spread batter into waffle maker (¼ cup per chaffle); close lid and cook until desired doneness, 3 to 6 minutes. Use a fork to carefully lift out chaffles; let cool 2 to 3 minutes. Garnish as desired.
armagazine.com/chaffles
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK
PER 4-INCH CHAFFLE: 121 CAL; 8G FAT (3G SAT); 9G PRO; 3G CARB (0G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 243MG SODIUM

“I fried up some burgers and ‘sandwiched’ them with these chaffles. It was heavenly! We’re going to do sloppy Joes tonight on these chaffles.”
– BROWNLEG

“For morning waffles, I added a dash of vanilla and cinnamon. For a tuna melt, I added garlic and onion powder. For a grilled cheese, I added a little bacon and onion seasoning.”
– CMD YHD
Chef John’s Buttermilk Biscuits

HANDS-ON 15 min.br>TOTAL 30 min.br>SERVES 16
SUBMITTED BY CHEF JOHN
1,022 REVIEWS

components.html:
4cups flour
4tsp. baking powder
2tsp. salt
½tsp. baking soda
¾cup plus 2 Tbsp. unsalted butter, cut into thin slices and frozen
1½cups cold buttermilk, plus 2 Tbsp. for brushing

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or foil.

<lede>2.</lede> Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a large bowl. Cut butter into flour mixture with a pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in center and stir in 1½ cups buttermilk until dough forms.
<lede>3.</lede> Turn dough out onto a floured surface and gently pat it into a rectangle. Fold in thirds. Rotate dough 90 degrees, gather any crumbs, and press back into a rectangle. Repeat twice.

<lede>4.</lede> Roll out dough to ¾ inch thick. Cut with a 3-inch biscuit cutter. Press scraps together once, patting to ¾ inch thick, and cut additional biscuits. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Press an indentation into top of each biscuit with your thumb to help it rise evenly.

<lede>5.</lede> Brush tops with remaining 2 Tbsp. buttermilk. Bake until browned 15 to 20 minutes. If desired, serve with Country Sausage Gravy, at right. (Store biscuits in an airtight container up to 1 day at room temperature or frozen up to 3 months.)
armagazine.com/chef-johns-buttermilk-biscuits
QUICK
PER BISCUIT: 380 CAL; 19G FAT (12G SAT); 7G PRO; 45G CARB (2G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 891MG SODIUM

“I received so many accolades on these wonderful biscuits! My daughter, a chef, said I should make them more often.”
– MUNIYRAH
Make It Gluten-Free

Substitute 4 cups Gluten-Free Flour Mix (below) for the flour. Add ¼ cup sugar along with other dry ingredients. Chill shaped biscuits 10 minutes in fridge or 5 minutes in freezer before baking.

Gluten-Free Flour Mix: Whisk together 1½ cups white rice flour, 1½ cups potato starch, 1 cup sorghum flour, and 2 tsp. xanthan gum in a bowl. Makes 4 cups.
Country Sausage Gravy

HANDS-ON 40 min.br>TOTAL 40 min.br>SERVES 8
SUBMITTED BY MALTBUSTER75
173 REVIEWS
<italic>For added flavor, stir in a little chopped fresh sage or thyme.</italic>

components.html:
12oz. fresh pork sausage
1cup finely chopped onion
1green bell pepper, finely chopped
1tsp. crushed red pepper
¼cup butter, cut into slices
¼cup flour
2cups milk
Black pepper, for garnish

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook sausage, onion, bell pepper, and crushed red pepper in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring and breaking up lumps, until vegetables are softened and pork is lightly browned, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain off grease.

<lede>2.</lede> Add butter to pork mixture; cook, stirring, over medium heat until melted. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add milk, ½ cup at a time, stirring until slightly thickened before each addition. Simmer gently, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. If desired, serve with Chef John’s Buttermilk Biscuits, at left, and garnish with black pepper.
armagazine.com/country-sausage-gravy
PER ½-CUP SERVING: 221 CAL; 15G FAT (7G SAT); 10G PRO; 10G CARB (1G FIBER, 5G SUGARS); 310MG SODIUM

“I’ve been trying to make sausage gravy for 14 years—I’m a city girl that married a country man. Finally my husband gave me a standing ovation for this recipe.”
– JONINE
Paleo Omelet Muffins

HANDS-ON 15 min.br>TOTAL 35 min.br>SERVES 12
SUBMITTED BY BECKI
309 REVIEWS

components.html:
8oz. cooked ham, finely chopped (1¾ cups)
1cup finely chopped red bell pepper
1cup finely chopped onion
8eggs
2Tbsp. water
¼tsp. salt
⅛tsp. black pepper
Sliced green onion, for garnish

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease twelve 2½-inch muffin cups or line with paper liners.

<lede>2.</lede> Stir together ham, bell pepper, and onion in a large bowl. Spoon ¼ cup ham mixture into each muffin cup. Whisk together eggs, water, salt, and black pepper in a bowl; spoon 2½ Tbsp. over ham mixture in each muffin cup. (Cups will be full.)

<lede>3.</lede> Bake until a knife inserted in centers of muffins comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes. Loosen edges of muffins with a knife, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool. Garnish with green onion. (Muffins keep up to 3 days, covered and chilled.)
armagazine.com/paleo-omelet-muffins
HEALTHY | QUICK
PER MUFFIN: 77 CAL; 4G FAT (1G SAT); 8G PRO; 2G CARB (0G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 275MG SODIUM

“These are great for big and little hands. I like to add chopped mushrooms and then sauté them lightly with veggies in a bit of butter before adding to the egg mixture.”
– GAIL COBILE
Creamy-Cheesy Scrambled Eggs With Basil

HANDS-ON 10 min.br>TOTAL 10 min.br>SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY ELISA STAMM
270 REVIEWS

components.html:
8eggs
⅓cup sour cream
1cup shredded mozzarella cheese
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
¼tsp. butter
2Tbsp. chopped fresh basil

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Whisk eggs and sour cream in a bowl until creamy and smooth. Stir in cheese and season with salt and pepper.

<lede>2.</lede> Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Pour in egg mixture; cook, gently folding occasionally with a spatula, until eggs reach desired consistency, about 3 minutes. Fold in basil during the last minute of cooking or sprinkle on just before serving.
armagazine.com/creamy-cheesy-scrambled-eggs-with-basil
QUICK | VEGETARIAN | GLUTEN-FREE
PER ¾ CUP: 278 CAL; 21G FAT (10G SAT); 18G PRO; 3G CARB (0G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 398MG SODIUM

“For more flavor, I mixed in minced garlic. I tried diced fresh tomato, but I wouldn’t recommend it—the juices made everything sort of runny.”
– LOTUS BLOSSOM
